item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 15, 2024 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Biological Miracle – Wood Frog (124 points | 28 comments)
2. Show HN: Free mortgage analysis tool to avoid getting screwed by closing costs (104 points | 40 comments)
3. Seer: A GUI front end to GDB for Linux (244 points | 149 comments)
4. C++ Template Macroprogramming versus Lisp Macros (24 points | 6 comments)
5. Tesla Has the Highest Fatal Accident Rate of All Auto Brands, Study Finds (77 points | 53 comments)
6. The Battle Line at Louvain (103 points | 56 comments)
7. The Practical Guide to Scaling Django (20 points | discuss)
8. Show HN: Scooter – Interactive find and replace in the terminal (81 points | 38 comments)
9. Emit-C: A time travelling programming language (20 points | 2 comments)
10. Show HN: OnAir – create link, receive calls (171 points | 76 comments)
11. Installed an open source garage door opener, and I'm loving it (29 points | 8 comments)
12. Pex: A tool for generating .pex (Python EXecutable) files, lock files and venvs (50 points | 25 comments)
13. Thomas E. Kurtz has died (406 points | 102 comments)
14. Gliimly is a programming language for web services (21 points | 12 comments)
15. MomBoard: E-ink display for a parent with amnesia (1795 points | 224 comments)
16. Show HN: Libretto – Simple recording and editing, an alternative to Descript (10 points | 3 comments)
17. Incorporation of photosynthetically active algal chloroplasts in mammalian cells (18 points | 9 comments)
18. Cyph – A cryptographically secure messaging and social networking service (6 points | 2 comments)
19. Modern Treasury (YC S18) Is Hiring a Product Designer ( | hide)
20. Go-taskflow: A taskflow-like General-purpose Task-parallel Programming Framework (19 points | 1 comment)
21. Something weird is happening with LLMs and chess (612 points | 414 comments)
22. Upcoming Hardening in PHP (298 points | 118 comments)
23. FBDetect: Catching Tiny Performance Regressions at Hyperscale [pdf] (46 points | 20 comments)
24. Norwegian fishermen hunting for halibut caught a US nuclear sub (101 points | 67 comments)
25. Speculations on arenas and custom strings in C++ (35 points | 4 comments)
26. Manual for PUB (a markup language in 1971) – Larry Tesler (59 points | 12 comments)
27. Building LawStar – a year long indie hacking journey (44 points | 19 comments)
28. The cochlear implant question (56 points | 100 comments)
29. Please stop the coding challenges (180 points | 371 comments)
30. First generation and control of skyrmions at room temperature in a 2D material (12 points | discuss)
